text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so 
for today's recipe I'm doing something super

super special I am grabbing the main ingredient 
straight out of the ocean it doesn't get better

or fresher than that now I don't know the first 
thing about fishing so I'm here with my with

the expert my good friend rod this is rod from 
fishing with Rob comm he is the expert when it

comes to fishing especially around the Vancouver 
area now I've lived in Vancouver for a very long

time I've never gone fishing and I didn't even 
know there was such good fishing around here so

rod what can we expect to be bringing home today 
yeah so there are so many different opportunities

when it comes to fishing in Vancouver for this 
javea in mid-february we're going to be doing

some crabbing and some proning there's a very 
beautiful spot prawn for this time of year yeah

and we're gonna be catching on winter chinook 
salmon no crap prawns and salmon hopefully

all in one trip that's right yeah this is pretty 
pretty exciting yeah yeah all right you ready no

I told you all right let's get started let's go 
we charted out a boat for the day with Jason as

our guide it was the perfect day to be outside in 
the beautiful Vancouver we started out with spot

prawns which are a local variety of shrimp with 
the sweetest juiciest meat I have ever had and

it's what I'm going to be cooking up in a little 
bit we then went to fish for some salmon but we

were completely unsuccessful better luck with 
crab though we got several succulent Dungeness

crabs which were so delicious just simply steamed 
we came back to shore and did some cooking right

on the boat and I show brought how to make the 
ultimate Thai dipping sauce for seafood if you

want to see me in some more fishing action there 
is a full video of this trip and I will put the

link to it in the description but for now let's 
head back to the kitchen alright so I am back

in my hot Thai kitchen the fishing trip was so 
much fun we didn't get any salmon but I got tons

of spot prawns which is what I am going to cook 
with so the recipe I'm going to show you today

is a quick stir-fry with a black pepper sauce in 
Thai it's called goong pad prik thai dum so goong is prawns

or shrimp Pad means to stir-fry and prik thai dum 
is black pepper now this is a sauce it's commonly

used for expensive seafood in Thailand so a lot 
of times you see this on crab or big river prawns

because it's got really good flavor yet it doesn't 
overwhelm the natural flavor of the seafood so

that's why I wanted to show you this recipe all 
right let's get our sauce mixed up versus what

I like to do before I stir-fry it really helps 
when you've got the wok oh and you don't have

to worry about eight different ingredients so 
I've got some oyster sauce here and then I've

also got some soy sauce if you want you can do a 
mixture of golden mountain and regular soy sauce

some Chinese cooking wine so Chinese cooking 
wine is obviously a Chinese and curative and

we use it quite a bit in Thai cooking as well it's 
a Chinese influence on Thai cuisine it's actually

quite readily available in Asian grocery stores 
it's not expensive even though it isn't alcohol

it's got a flavour similar to sake but it's a 
little salty it's not absolutely necessary but

have a look at your store I'm pretty sure you'll 
be able to find it a little bit of chicken stock

and to cut all that salt just a little bit 
of sugar the sauce is not going to actually

taste sweet but you really need that little bit of 
sugar to balance the salt and also to enhance the

natural sweetness of the seafood okay so that's 
the sauce pretty much all right black pepper I've

got what looks like a ton of black pepper and that 
is exactly the point black pepper actually has a

beautiful aroma and a nice spicy hot flavor but 
it's a different kind of spiciness from chilies

but usually when people cook with black pepper 
you can barely taste it it's sprinkled here and

there so now is the chance where you can really 
taste black pepper and trust me it is very good

so I'm going to get that ground up so here are 
my spot prawns now if you can't get ahold of

spot prawns that's okay just use any large ish 
medium ich head-on shell on shrimp you want the

head on and shell on they really do contribute 
to the flavor of the dish okay and you can get

those at any sort of Asian supermarket that has a 
seafood counter so what I'm going to do is see all

this messy and Tenay sticking up everywhere you 
want to trim those off along with the really sharp

pointy bit in front and then with small scissors 
I cut through the back and that'll allow you to

devein them and also it'll make it easier to eat 
and it'll allow the sauce to make contact with

the meat alright time to cook now this is going 
to go very quickly which is what I love because

if you spend all this time fishing for things 
you don't want to spend too much time cooking

it okay so in goes a little bit of vegetable oil 
and I'm also going to add my garlic and you don't

have to wait for the pan to get hot for this in 
fact I don't like waiting for the pan to get hot

because sometimes it gets too hot and then I burn 
my garlic and all of the black pepper now I should

say that this amount of black pepper will actually 
make it hot so you're serving kids or someone who

really can't handle spicy food you might want 
to cut it down just a little bit let a little

bit more oil here because the black pepper does 
absorb a lot of liquid alright so let that Brown

for about thirty Seconds to 45 seconds you will 
be able to smell this in the entire house alright

that looks good and now I'm going to go in with 
the cilantro stems this is a benefit of cooking

with cilantro stems you can actually cook them 
without them turning black and wilty like the

leaves would to give that just a few more seconds 
to infuse and yes if you have cilantro roots you

can pound that up or chopped up chop that up and 
add it to here as well add all my sauce mixture

I'm going to let this reduce just a little bit 
really concentrate that flavor of the chicken

stock that we added and also it allowed the garlic 
and the pepper and the cilantro to infuse into the

sauce and really marry all the flavors now I've 
waited until the sauce is now thickened now I'm

going to add my shrimp and you can really crank 
the heat at this point give this a quick toss

just going to cook these for literally less than 
a minute until they are cooked through hmm now I

have to say that spot prawns are unique in that 
they are already pink when they're raw a lot of

shrimp are a gray or bluish in color and by 
the way if it gets too dry and it starts to

stick don't be afraid to add just a splash of 
water but not too much you don't want to dilute

the sauce you want everything to be nice and 
tight the shrimp are almost done I'm going to

go in with the onions and the bell pepper and 
just give them a toss don't want to cook them

to death I still want them to be bright and fresh 
gonna add just a splash of water and that's pretty

much it we're done and by the way if you are 
using spot prawns they are kind of a pain to

peel when they're raw so that's another reason 
why you want to cook them with the shell on and

just a final touch the cilantro leaves I like to 
just do a whole bunch cuz it's you know there's

no green in the dish a big pile of cilantro and 
then people can just sort of mix it in as they

want how pretty is that if you got some great 
seafood even crab will do I did this another the

other day with trout so really this sauce works 
with any kind of good seafood that you've got on

hand all right normally we would have this with 
rice but I'm just gonna eat it fresh like this

and as you can see look how much sauce there is 
now and that's true for all surf rice it looks

drier in the wok as it sits sauce always comes 
out oh yes look at that juicy succulent flesh

going to dip this in the sauce mmm oh my god 
sweet tender super juicy that's a benefit of

cooking shrimp prawns excuse me in the shell and 
that flavor that spicy peppery garlicky sauce is

complemented without overwhelming it up so I hope 
you give this recipe a try the next time you've

got some really good seafood on hand the recipe 
will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm as our ways and

if you want to check out the rest of the fishing 
action to see what went down when we try to get

these fantastic seafood you can check out Rodney's 
channel at fishing with rod if you live in this

part of the world and you're into fishing Rodney's 
website fishing with rod comm is so informative so

make sure you check that out and I will see 
you next time for your next delicious time
